response_dict_list.question: What makes Sam Altman a good founder?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: He has a great force of will.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Sam Altman is considered a good founder because he has been successful in his ventures, such as Loopt, and is highly regarded in the startup community. He is often referenced alongside Steve Jobs as a founder to look up to, indicating that he has made significant contributions to the industry. Additionally, the mention of him being the "original young founder" suggests that he has been recognized for his innovative and entrepreneurial spirit.
retrieved_context: Honestly, Sam is, along with Steve Jobs, the founder I refer to most when I'm advising startups.

response_dict_list.question: When does the most dramatic growth happen for a startup?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: When the startup only has three or four people.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The most dramatic growth for a startup happens in the earliest phase when the startup only has three or four people.
retrieved_context: The really dramatic growth happens when a startup only has three or four people,

response_dict_list.question: What is the problem with business culture versus start up culture with respect to productivity?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: In business culture, energy is expended on outward appearance to the detriment of productivity, while in startup culture there is no value of appearance it's all about productivity.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The problem with business culture versus start-up culture with respect to productivity is that conventional ideas of professionalism have a strong influence on our minds, even affecting start-up founders. This adherence to traditional notions of productivity actually hinders organizations from being truly productive.
retrieved_context: )Ditto for most of the other differences between startups and what passes for productivity in big companies.
only a handful people got to see: what happens in the first year of a startup.This is what real productivity looks like.

Business is broken the same way that car was.The effort that goes into looking productive is not merely wasted, but actually makes organizations less productive.

response_dict_list.question: How could one create a rigorous government definition of what a startup is to categorize whether a business is a startup?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: One could define a startup as a company that has received investment by recognized startup investors. An accreditation procedure would be determined to establish recognized startup investors.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: One possible approach to creating a rigorous government definition of what a startup is could be to let the market decide. This means that the government could consider using investment by recognized startup investors as a test to determine whether a company qualifies as a startup. By relying on the judgment of experienced investors who specialize in supporting startups, the government can establish a reliable criterion for categorizing businesses as startups.
retrieved_context: and use investment by recognized startup investors as the test of whether a company was a real startup.How would the government decide who's a startup investor?

response_dict_list.question: Why is frienship a good quality of founders?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Friendship is a good quality of founders because building a startup is tough and without a strong friendship building the startup will tear the founders apart.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Friendship is a good quality of founders because it allows them to genuinely like and work well with each other. This strong relationship between founders is important for the success of a startup.
retrieved_context: FriendshipEmpirically it seems to be hard to start a startup with just one founder.Most of the big successes have two or three.
And the relationship between the founders has to be strong.They must genuinely like one another, and work well together.
Why It's Safe for Founders to Be
[3]The reason startup founders can safely be nice is that making great things is compounded, and rapacity isn't.

response_dict_list.question: Why is determination the most important quality in startup founders?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Because when building a startup you're going to hit a lot of obstacles, and determination will prevent one from getting demoralized by the constant obstacles.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Determination is considered the most important quality in startup founders because it is what drives them to succeed. While intelligence is important, as long as founders meet a certain threshold, determination is what sets them apart. The company becomes their project, and their determination to make it successful is what motivates them to work hard and overcome challenges. This is why determination is highly valued by startup investors when evaluating potential founders.
retrieved_context: DeterminationThis has turned out to be the most important quality in startup founders.
And certainly you don't want founders to be stupid.But as long as you're over a certain threshold of intelligence, what matters most is determination.
What drives the most successful founders is the same thing that drives most people who make things: the company is their project.
Startup investors work hard to find the best startups.

response_dict_list.question: For startups, what does board control mean in practice?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: During board meetings, matters are decided in the discussion preceding the vote, not in the vote itself, which is usually unanimous. If opinion is divided in such discussions, the side that knows it would lose in a vote tends to be less insistent. This is what board control means in practice.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Board control in the context of startups refers to the ability of the founders to maintain control over the decision-making process and overall direction of the company through their representation on the board of directors. This means that the founders have the power to influence and make key strategic decisions for the startup, even after a series A round of funding.
retrieved_context: That's what board control means in practice.
Which means if it becomes the norm for founders to retain board control after a series A, that will change the way things feel in the whole startup world.
and asked me how common it was for a startup's founders to retain control of the board after a series A round.
Knowing that founders will keep control of the board may even help VCs pick better.

response_dict_list.question: What's in the way of founders keeping board control after a series A?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: The perception that founders keeping board control after a series A being a concession a VC has made when negotiating with startups. VCs do not want to look like they've lost a negotiation. If founders keeping control after a series A is the norm, then it happening will not look like the VCs lost the negotiation.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: There may be several factors that can hinder founders from retaining board control after a series A round. These factors could include the preferences and demands of venture capitalists (VCs) who typically invest in series A rounds. VCs often seek to have a say in the decision-making process and may want to have a significant influence on the board to protect their investment. Additionally, VCs may have more experience and expertise in scaling and growing companies, which they believe can be beneficial for the startup's success. Therefore, it is not uncommon for VCs to negotiate for board control in order to have a greater say in the company's strategic direction.
retrieved_context: A lot of VCs still act as if founders retaining board control after a series A is unheard-of.
and asked me how common it was for a startup's founders to retain control of the board after a series A round.
In the past, founders rarely kept control of the board through a series A.
Founders retaining control after a series A is clearly heard-of.And barring financial catastrophe, I think in the coming year it will become the norm.
